alert.note: Alert for Anson; Montgomery; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Anson, southern Montgomery, northwestern Richmond and southeastern Stanly Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 739 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ansonville, or 13 miles north of Wadesboro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ansonville, Norwood, Mount Gilead, Ellerbe, Norman, Uwharrie Haven, Blewett Falls Lake, Derby, Covington and Pekin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
